body_html:
So I put a prototype regenerator/tester for torch/_torch_docs.py that could be a base for test/test_docs.py.
It has two modes, one testing torch docstrings (but not with exitcodes yet) and one where it outputs a new torch/_torch_docs.py to stdout.
It uses astor and autopep8 as dependencies and probably runs best on python3.
The would be generated documentation is at torch/_torch_docs.py.
body_text:
So I put a prototype regenerator/tester for torch/_torch_docs.py that could be a base for test/test_docs.py.
It has two modes, one testing torch docstrings (but not with exitcodes yet) and one where it outputs a new torch/_torch_docs.py to stdout.
It uses astor and autopep8 as dependencies and probably runs best on python3.
The would be generated documentation is at torch/_torch_docs.py.
body:
So I put a prototype regenerator/tester for torch/_torch_docs.py that could be a base for [test/test_docs.py](https://github.com/t-vi/pytorch/blob/docstring_regeneration/test/test_docs.py).
It has two modes, one testing torch docstrings (but not with exitcodes yet) and one where it outputs a new torch/_torch_docs.py to stdout.
It uses astor and autopep8 as dependencies and probably runs best on python3.
The would be generated documentation is at [torch/_torch_docs.py](https://github.com/t-vi/pytorch/blob/docstring_regeneration/torch/_torch_docs.py).
